snippet: Health officials said the step would help the three million Americans with celiac disease and bring uniformity to the $4 billion market for gluten-free foods.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration sets standard for gluten-free claims on food labels, step that health officials say will help the three million Americans with celiac disease and bring uniformity to the $4 billion market for gluten-free foods.
lead_paragraph: Health officials said the step would help the three million Americans with celiac disease and bring uniformity to the $4 billion market for gluten-free foods.

headline.main: F.D.A. Sets a Standard on Labeling ‘Gluten Free’
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Sets A Standard On Labeling ‘Gluten Free’
